abstract.text: Use the
namespace to configure CloudKit JS, and to access app containers and global constants.

inlineContent.text: Set up CloudKit JS by passing container and authentication information to the

method. Also, specify whether to use the development or production environment. You’ll need the container ID and API token to configure CloudKit JS. (Use CloudKit Dashboard to create an API token, as described in
.) Some operations require users to enter their Apple ID credentials. Apple presents the sign-in dialog, but you can customize the position and theme of the sign-in and sign-out buttons.
After configuring CloudKit JS, use the container methods to get the app’s container objects (
), and from the container objects, get the database objects (

abstract.text: Provide access from your web app to your CloudKit app’s containers and databases.
Use the
namespace to configure CloudKit JS, and to access app containers and global constants.
Specifies the look of the Apple ID button.
A
object encapsulates an error that may occur when you use CloudKit JS. This includes CloudKit server errors and local errors.
Dictionary used to configure the CloudKit environment.
A
object provides access to an app container, and through the app container, access to its databases. It also contains methods for authenticating and fetching users.
A configuration for a container.
A
object represents a public or private database in an app container.
Saves one or more subscriptions to record changes.
A
object encapsulates the results of fetching changed record zones in a database.
Available database scopes.
The parts of the user’s name.
A

object represents a push notification that was sent to your app. Notifications are triggered by subscriptions that you save to the database. To subscribe to record changes and handle push notifications, see the
method in
Information about a notification.
Search parameters to use when fetching records from the database.
The comparators you use to create queries.
A
object represents a push notification that was generated by a subscription object. A query notification is triggered by subscriptions where the

object to get information about the record that changed. To create query subscriptions and handle push notifications, see the

A
object encapsulates the results of using a query to fetch records
A record in the database.
A field value of a record.
Encapsulates the results of fetching information about a record.
A
object encapsulates the results of fetching information about records in general and shared records in particular.
Represents a record zone.
Represents the changes in a record zone.
Options about fetching changes in a record zone.
The
object encapsulates the results of fetching changes to one or more record zones.
A
object represents a push notification that was caused by changes to the contents of a record zone. A zone notification is triggered by subscriptions where the
key is
. Use a
object to get information about the record that changed. To create zone subscriptions and handle push notifications, see the
method in
A
object encapsulates the results of database operations on a record zone.
A
object encapsulates the results of changes to multiple records in a single database operation.
A
object encapsulates the results of fetching records.
The delete action for a reference object.
The
class is an abstract superclass for subclasses that encapsulate the response from server requests. Don’t create instances of this class. Instances of subclasses are returned by methods in the
and
classes. Most of these methods return a
object that resolves to a subclass of
if the operation is successful.
Represents a shared record.
Represents a user who accepted a shared record.
The status of a participant accepting a share invitation.
The status of a participant accepting a share invitation.
Determines whether a participant can modify the list of participants of a shared record.
Display information about the record type of a shared record.
Represents the results of sharing a record with other users.
A subscription, which is a persistent query on the server that tracks the creation, deletion, and modification of records.
The type of subscription.
A
object encapsulates the results of database operations on subscriptions.
A
object encapsulates the results of fetching user identities.
Information to identify a user.
Information that can be used to fetch a user.
An identifier for a zone, which is an area in a database for organizing related records.
Property to access the error codes.
Property to access the enumeration.

Returns the default container.
